Una joya, juego mas espectacular; la historia te obliga a rejugarla sin necesidad de aburrite ni volverse tediosa, los DLC de historia son hermoso y te dan de 1 a 2 horas mas de juego.
Simplemente magnifico.

Je sais que cet opus ne fait pas l'unanimitÃ©, mais personnellement..wow. J'ai surkiffÃ© cet opus ! tout comme le premier opus j'y retourne environ tous les 2 mois tellement cet univers me manque parfois. Par ce que oui l'univers est vraiment le point fort de ce jeu. La citÃ© columbia est consistante et magnifique, vraiment. Les personnages sont vraiment attachants et l'histoire...trÃ¨s perturbante mais c'est ce qui fait le grain de cet opus selon moi. Le gameplay des plasmides ici remplacÃ© par les toniques est parfait. On peut s'amuser Ã  faire des combinaisons de pouvoir pour aborder les niveaux differement.
Je vous conseil Ã©normement de jouer aux dlc offerts "le tombeau sous marin" qui nous replonge Ã  rapture (juste magnifique graphiquement) et qu nous eclaire sur l'histoire de la trilogie. Bref foncez 8/10 pour moi (oui y'a un point faible quand mÃªme, c'est le gameplay avec les aerotrams qui est a chiÃ©)

just a well made game

however there is a horrible bug on linux where the textures don't load in properly that can make this gorgeous looking game really ugly sometimes.
apparently there is a way you can fix this by reinstalling the game which I didn't care to do. So do look it up before you install the game.

Comment:The game itself is a masterpiece. I've seen people not liking the changes of the gameplay but i enjoyed it's gameplay the most!
The story, the characters & the music are fantastic! I had low expectations from this game but here i am, liking Infinite the most! And also i'm very satisfied that they gave the protagonist a proper identity!

DLC: The best DLC i've ever experienced in my life! you'll be amazed that how the DLC manages to tie things together!

Looking forward to Bioshock 4! Until then, farewell to one of the best trilogies i've ever played!

A lot of people will say that this is the worst one. I cannot be the judge of that but all I'll say is that this is an incredible game with a great story and gameplay. The interplay betwee weapons and abilities at the same time at this level (not comparing to other bioshock games) I believe is second to very few if not none. I wish that we get more weapon mechanics and abilities like this updated to a more modern era of gaming. How cool would it be to have abilities at this level but have gunplay like the doom remakes. If only irrational didnt get shutdown

I finished BioShock 1 & 2 Remastered, but I got bored of this game at about the 4 hour mark, so everything I say is based on the early game experience. I liked the art and the new premise but the AI was the worst AI I think I've seen in a AAA game and the gun play was unsatisfying. But a lot of others like the game, so I would say it's worth a try if you can catch it on sale.

I thoroughly enjoyed the game. The idea of playing out the story from the beginning and hiding it from the player is pulled off phenomenally. Additionally, the game is very rewarding if you listen to all the recordings. 

The look of Columbia is done in such a way that it simply pleases the eye. The brilliantly stylized design and sounds create an incomparable experience. 

The supporting characters are interesting and very memorable. Elizabeth herself is probably the most useful NPC I've ever seen. And the coin trick is just a *chef kiss*

Of all the Bioshocks, even though the sheer use of weapons and Vigors has been trimmed it is the smoothest so far. It is a great pity that the system with the gun wheel from dlc was not included in the main game.

I also really enjoyed the Burial at Sea DLC even though the end took me by surprise once I figured out what was going to happen. And it was a bittersweet feeling that happens really rarely to me. The non-standard gameplay really appealed to me. The stealth + those goals animations, hacking and crossbow really suited the noir style of Elizabeth alone in Rapture. 

It was the most enjoyable of Bioshock for me and I would put it on par with the first
